titlestmt.titleproper: J. Walter Thompson Company. 16mm microfilm Accounting Department records
Guide to the J. Walter Thompson Company. 16mm microfilm Accounting Department records, 1942-1954 RL.11717
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-04-05 15:45:33 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. 16mm microfilm Accounting Department records
did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. It is headquartered in New York. Collection includes lists of cancelled checks, petty cash vouchers and invoices, summaries of advertising production expenses and labor costs and other financial data. Main JWT offices represented include New York, Chicago, Detroit, Los Angeles and San Francisco. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: Checks Cancelled; Petty Cash; Production Billing

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. It is headquartered in New York.

Beginning in the 1930s, documents from several JWT departments and functions were microfilmed, including Legal Department, Treasurer's Office, As Broadcast Scripts and Commercials for Radio and Television, Investigations, Publicity Department, Artwork, Consumer Panel, and Radio/Television Department. Documents were microfilmed in no order, and typed and hand-written indices were produced for the microfilms. It is believed that once microfilmed, most of the original documents were destroyed.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. 16mm microfilm Accounting Department records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1987.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. 16mm microfilm Accounting Department records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:
J. Walter Thompson Company. Alun Jones papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Corporate documentation;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Edward G. Wilson papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Glen Dell papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Treasurer's Office records

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes lists of cancelled checks, petty cash vouchers and invoices, summaries of advertising production expenses and labor costs and other financial data. Main JWT offices represented include New York, Chicago, Detroit, Los Angeles and San Francisco. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
